data.title: Emmy Nominations Announced – 18 Black Actors Nominated
data.meta_description: With Taraji P. Henson and Viola Davis, it's 1st time 2 black women have EVER been nominated for Lead Actress Drama in the same year. More
data.text:
Emmy Nominations Announced – 18 Black Actors NominatedPosted by Wilson Morales

July 16, 2015

Remember this day in history as the 2015 Primetime Emmy Awards were announced on July 16. While HBO’s “Game of Thrones” received the most nominations, the most important thing to know is that a record number of Black actors (18) were nominated, shattering last year’s record of 11.

Let’s start with Viola Davis and Taraji P. Henson both nominated for Lead Actress in a Drama Series. Keep in mind that two or more black women have never been nominated in this category in the same year. Also, the two women are competing again for the first time since being nominated for Best Supporting Actress in 2008 for Doubt and The Curious Case of Benjamin Button respectively.

When’s the last time you saw three Blacks nominated in the same category? Well, Congrats to Andre Braugher, Keegan Michael-Key & Tituss Burgess on their Emmys nods for Supporting Actor in a Comedy.

HBO’s Bessie scored major nominations for director Dee Rees, Queen Latifah, Monique and Michael K. Wiliams among others. Rees scored another nomination for writing Bessie. As creator of ABC’s American Crime, Oscar winner John Ridley got two nominations for Best Limited Series and Best Writing of a Limited Series.

Not listed in this list are Lawrence Davis on his Emmy nod for Hairstyling For A Limited Series Or Movie for HBO’s Bessie. He’s the Dept Head Hairstylist. Rashida Jones also received an Emmy nod for Exceptional Merit in Documentary Filmmaking as Co-Producer for the Netflix doc Hot Girls Wanted; Greg Phillinganes for serving as musical director ‘Stevie Wonder: Songs In The Key Of Life – An All-Star GRAMMY Salute.’

Andy Samberg will host the 2015 Primetime Emmy Awards on September 20. Fox will broadcast them live from the Microsoft Theater in downtown Los Angeles.
